channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: ‘Heist of a century’: How robbers broke into Louvre & stole ‘priceless’ jewels under 8 mins
Half of the internet was down on Monday. Here’s why
History Today: When Subhas Chandra Bose declared the Azad Hind Government
FirstUp: Sarkozy to begin his prison term, Japan set to vote in its first woman PM… The news today
In Photos | Cyprus, the island where there's a cat for every one of its 1 million inhabitants
Ditch gyms: Why bodyweight training is all you need to stay fit
US Sutra | Trump handling: How to tackle India’s foreign policy challenge
item.description: With Shehbaz Sharif’s flattery falling flat and with China’s squeeze on rare earths, India has a new opening

item.title: Ceasefire without architecture: Why Gaza’s peace cannot hold
item.description: The Gaza ceasefire offers calm but no compass. Without enforcement, leadership renewal, or political vision, it remains a ceasefire without architecture — not a path to peace

item.title: Why many Sikhs visit Gwalior on Diwali
item.description: On Diwali day, when Guru Hargobind walked out to freedom, each of the imprisoned kings held one hem and walked behind him, thus creating a mass Bandi Chorr Diwas which is commemorated till today across gurudwaras

item.title: Lahore protests, rise of Tehreek-e-Labbaik reveal Pakistan’s deeper malaise
item.description: The TLP’s support base cuts across Punjab’s urban working class, and its religious messaging resonates with segments of the population disenchanted with mainstream parties—Pakistan now struggles to contain the forces its own politics fostered

item.title: How Chinese claims on Garhwal’s Barahoti are absurd, a result of India’s ‘good-boy’ syndrome
item.description: It is absurd that such a humble pastureland or ‘bowl’ has mobilised so many resources and defence manpower simply due to Chinese hegemonistic tendencies

item.title: Madagascar coup: How Indian Ocean Region has become a ring of instability
item.description: It is not about the size of the nations or their populations, but about a triggering issue that could bring the people to the streets
